description.narrative: Strengthening Local Governance in Darfur and Eastern States through training and actual local development planning based on assessment of rights-holders needs

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1) Strategic review of the local governance capacities and assessment of knowledge gap with integrated annual work-plans designed and operationalized. 2) Information system, database and archiving established. 3) # of the capacity building trainings conducted. 4) Advanced training on community partnership for local authorities on joint planning conducted. 5) # of Public events to raise awareness and stimulate public participation in local governance organized. 6) Training on finance and administration 7) Study tour to countries emerging from crisis conducted. 8) Awareness materials on promoting peace culture and society integration to strengthen the consensus building and support stability developed and disseminated. 9) UNDP Sudan Gender Equality Strategy and Action Plan are well aligned with UNDP corporate Gender Equality Strategy (GES). 10) UNDP has planned and implemented strategic actions for capacity-building on gender 11) Produce a map of youth leading organization and initiatives working in peace and building resilient communities. 12) A roster of talented Youth peace groups is produced 13) A fully documented film produced to reflect Youth new interventions 14) 5th Youth Leadership programme (YLP5) conducted with series of workshops/trainings based on peacebuilding and conflict resolution concepts

comment.narrative: - Low capacity on good governance at the state and locality levels characterized by weak community leadership. - Capacity of strategic planning hubs is low in the project operation areas(to be confirmed via assessment)

1.1.1:Undertake strategic review of the local governance capacities (including a brief gender analysis) to map strengths and gap including native administration leaders) and Design training package to cover areas detected in the training needs assessment. Including recommendations for enhancing mandates/strategic plans, resources to set baselines for pilot localities using participatory approaches. 1.1.2:Design and operationalize standard state and locality level annual work plans integrating new activities focusing on strengthening the internal controls and promoting Inter-State and inter-locality coordination for pilot localities using participatory approaches. 1.1.3:Establishment of information system, database and archiving to perform continuous data analysis for future review 1.2.1: Assessment of gap of knowledge on good governance principles, constitution and laws (need to include native administration leaders) and Design training package to cover areas detected in the training needs assessment. 1.2.2: A number of at least 6 advanced trainings/workshops conducted for executive and legislative leaders on the importance of good governance, Laws, constitutions along with the need of transparency and accountability mechanisms and Post-crisis area management advanced towards better Conflict prevention, conflict Management, community stabilization Action 2.1.1:At least 3 Advanced training on community participation for local authorities on joint user-based planning conducted Action 2.1.2: Organize at least 3 public events to raise awareness and stimulate public participation in local governance through better use of media outreach and setting locality level media plans (use of drama, locally popular mediums like radio and also social media, etc) Action 3.1.1:Conduct specialized trainings for finance and administration staff in State/locality Governments on Budgets, revolving funds, public financial management principles and Procurement based on need identified in Action 1.1.1 Action: 3.2.1:Conduct study tour to countries emerging from crisis to witness success stories on best area management, financial resources management, conflict management, promotion of peace culture and land use Action: 3.2.2:Develop and disseminate awareness materials on promoting peace culture and society integration to strengthen the consensus building and support stability. This involves broadcast awareness materials through mass media Action: 4.1.1:Update and implement the Gender Equality Strategy (GES) Action: 4.1.2:Organize specialized gender trainings and perspective building sessions for all UNDP staff Action: 4.2.1:Conduct an assessment targeting youth organization and initiatives to understand their engagements strategies, intervention mechanism, experiences and approaches towards resolving conflict and peace building efforts and identifying new gaps, entry points and solutions.) Action: 4.2.2:Identify a pool of the Youth peace group through organize a workshop on the concept of peace-building and conflict resolutions, strategic planning, monitoring and evaluation, targeting representatives from youth serving organization to build on their capacities Action 4.2.3: Documentation of the success case studies of the Youth new interventions related to peace-building and change making Action 4.2.4: At least (5) workshops/trainings for mobilization of the youth groups through conducting the 5th edition of the Youth Leadership Programme (YLP5) focused on peace-building, Making change and conflict resolution concepts and methodologies.

Output1: Capacity Building on Good Governance and internal control and communication systems Results: • UNDP has contracted an international expert on local governance to conduct a country wide assessment of the local governance systems before and after the revolution and design a local governance programme that will inform UNDP programming in the transzonal period and beyond. • UNDP has concluded an agreement with the Chamber of local governance that aims to provide training to services and change committees which are currently working in coordination with the localities across Sudan. The focus of the training will not be on budget development as cited in component 1.2, it will focus on provision of support to localities and monitoring delivery of service. • all legislative councils in Sudan have being dissolved after the revolution, no capacity building activities were undertaken. Allocation of this activities has been re-programmed for 2020. • Activities under the establishment of the locality level development strategic has been suspended given the political situation during the reporting period. Funds have been reprogrammed for 2020 plans
Output2: States development plans designed through continuous support and teams of national development planning officers with multidisciplinary backgrounds, such as development specialists, legal officers, environmental specialist, conflict prevention expert as well as gender specialists are formed. This includes, support to governance mechanisms for SDGs localization, including capacities for SDGs-based local development planning: Results: • Activities under the component of supporting the governance mechanisms for SDGs localization were not implemented for the political situation prevailing during the reporting period. Funds allocated for it were re-programmed for 2020 • For the local government capacity building on partnerships with local communities for multidimensional planning, SDGs localization and implementation activities were reprogrammed for 2020 due to the political situation. • In August 2019, a collaborative effort was made between UNDP and University of Khartoum teaching staff initiative to draw a road map for the federal and local governance in Sudan during the transitional period. The following goals were addressed: o Identification of the problems and challenges with the local governance in Sudan o Set short- and long-term plans for reforming local governance system
The workshop recommendations were focused on designing of programs and practical solutions to local governance in Sudan during the transitional period

- Production of new Legal framework for LG. -Undertake strategic review of the current local governance act to map the strengths and gaps in order to produce a coherent and responsive act - Advanced Training of Trainers (TOT) for building the capacities of the members of Changes and Services Committees (CSCs) -Form a committee of seven plus secretariats, to prepare a curriculum to make use of it in training (CSCs)
